definition: part of speech (noun, verb, adjective etc)/lexical category
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Nominal predication and verbalized noun are two phenomena in Contemporary, Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 体词性谓语现象是一种语言现象。

sentences.english: This paper first explores unsupervised part-of-speech tagging for Chinese via monolingual corpus.
sentences.chinese: 本文首先探索了基于单语料库的无监督中文词性标注。

sentences.english: "Errant Knight"has different parts of speech and related meanings in ancient Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 在古代汉语中，“侠”字具有多种词性和丰富的内涵。

sentences.english: Do they have errors in word formation ?
sentences.chinese: 他们是否有词性方面的错误？

sentences.english: These words could be synonymized although they are not the same part of speech.
sentences.chinese: 尽管它们的词性不同，你可以把它们看做同义词。

sentences.english: The words are not case sensitive and Subject-Verb Agreement does not matter.
sentences.chinese: 字典里的单词只会有一种词性。

sentences.english: Try to start most subheadings with the same part of speech, such as a verb or a noun.
sentences.chinese: 副标题开头的短语应该尽量词性相同。

sentences.english: Most dictionaries give the etymology, or the origin, of each word.
sentences.chinese: 大多数字典会提供每个字的词性和缘由。

sentences.english: Finally, a example is used to illustrate the acquiring method of ambiguity word POS tagging rules.
sentences.chinese: 最后实例说明汉语兼类词词性标注规则的获取方法。

definition: subject-verb-object SVO or subject-predicate-object sentence pattern (e.g. in Chinese grammar)
